body_text: Reiterating it‚Äôs earlier demand made on 5th July, @CAITIndia has today once again written to Union Minister Shri @rsprasad urging the Govt @DoT_India to ban China‚Äôs Huawei & ZTE Corporation from 5G Network rollout in India, in line with other steps taken so far.#BoycottChina üáÆüá≥ https://t.co/K2JarNieNr

1 August 2020

Shri Ravi Shankar Prasad

Honble Minister for Information Technology

Government of India

New Delhi

Dear Shri Ravi Shankar Prasad Ji

Subject  G Network rollout in India Ban on Huawei ZTE Technology

We invoke your kind and immediate attention to our earlier communication sent to your good self urging

to ban usage of Huawei ZTE Corporation in SG network roll out in India With reference to the subject

cited above and in continuation of boycott Chinese products campaign launched by the Confederation

of All India Traders CAIT on 10th June 2020 under its mission statement Bhartiya SaamaanHamara

Abhimaan which is receiving a tremendous and spontaneous response from people of the Country from all

nook  corners we urge your kind and immediate attention to the following point

1 The Huawei 8 ZTE Corporation of China should be banned from participating in SG network rollout

in India Iti also urged that technology and equipment of both Huawei and ZTE Corporation should be

banned for use in 5

network rollout by any Company

2 Ithas been learnt that Huawei and ZTE the two Chinese companies have applied for participating in SG

network infrastructure to be rolled out in India soon Considering various steps taken by the Government

in month of June we believe that such steps from the Government will pave the way for an opportunity for

Indian companies to grab the opportunity to create their own software 8 hardware required for SG network

and will result into an Indian robust telecom infrastructure which will be beneficial for improving Countrys

exports and imports to a greater extent On the other hand it will play a crucial and an important key role to

leverage the vocal on local and the  Atmnirbhar Bharat call of Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modilt is

worthwhile to mention that recently the UK government has asked all telecom operators to remove existing

Huawei equipment

3 We appreciate that realising the situation the Government took timely steps

n banning 59 Chinese apps

in June and within less than a month after banning 59 apps the Government again banned 47 Chinese apps

that were operating as clones of the earlier banned applications Itis also learnt from the media reports that

India has also prepared a list of over 250 Chinese apps including apps linked to Alibaba that it will examine

for any user privacy or national security violations The list also includes Tencent backed gaming app PUBG

rts

4 There isa great apprehension that Huawei technology may provide an inner system to enable surveillance

Needless to mention that there is a rapid distrust of China not only in India but across the globe which has

been further increased by Chinas policy to control 8 dominate various sector through its software and

hardware system the COVID pandemic and recent events ofa war like situation in border areas particularly

in Galwan in Ladakh necessitates a need to have a network system which is progressive and clean from end

to end free from any kind of interception of data that may prove fatal for the security and sovereignty of the

Country
